channel.title: Wack Pack Stories
channel.itunes:author: Optimus Prime
channel.description:
Journey into the wild and wonderful world of the Howard Stern Show's most colorful characters through Wack Pack Stories. This captivating series delves deep into the unforgettable moments, legendary personalities, and outrageous encounters that have made the Wack Pack a cultural phenomenon. Each episode uncovers the fascinating stories behind these unique individuals who have become an integral part of radio history.
From their first appearances to their most memorable interactions, Wack Pack Stories chronicles the authentic, unfiltered, and often hilarious experiences that have entertained millions of listeners. Through carefully curated archives and insider perspectives, this podcast preserves and celebrates the legacy of these distinctive personalities who have helped shape the landscape of entertainment radio.
Disclaimer: This podcast contains adult content and language. All content related to the Howard Stern Show and its personalities is presented for entertainment purposes. This description is experimental and was generated by artificial intelligence.
channel.itunes:summary: Explores memorable characters and outrageous moments from Howard Stern Show Wack Pack history through archived recordings.

itunes:category.text: Comedy > Comedy Interviews, Entertainment > TV & Film, Society & Culture > Personal Journals

item.title: High Pitch vs Elephant Boy: When Death Threats Go to Court
item.itunes:title: High Pitch vs Elephant Boy: When Death Threats Go to Court
item.description:
Dive into one of the most explosive confrontations in Howard Stern Show history as Wack Pack Stories examines the infamous 2016 feud between High Pitch Erik and Fred the Elephant Boy. This gripping episode chronicles how playful radio banter escalated into genuine legal drama when High Pitch allegedly made death threats against his fellow Wack Packer. What began as typical Stern Show rivalry took an unprecedented turn as the NYPD became involved, culminating in a New York City judge issuing a legitimate protective order. The episode details how this unique conflict played out in both an actual courthouse and the show's comedic "Special People's Court," showcasing the surreal nature of Wack Pack dynamics. With the recent passing of Fred the Elephant Boy in January 2025, this retrospective gains additional poignancy as it examines one of the most memorable chapters in Wack Pack history. Through archival audio and firsthand accounts, listeners will experience the raw intensity of this feud that exemplified the unpredictable, unfiltered, and utterly distinctive world of Howard Stern's most notorious personalities.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The Howard Stern Show: The Wack Pack Years" - Documentary (https://primevideo.com/howard-stern-wack-pack) • "Remembering Fred the Elephant Boy" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/2025/01/fred-the-elephant-boy-tribute) • "The Complete History of the Wack Pack" (https://www.rollingstone.com/wack-pack-history)

item.title: When Baba Booey Met High Pitch: The Joey Boots Legacy
item.itunes:title: When Baba Booey Met High Pitch: The Joey Boots Legacy
item.description:
Delve into one of the Howard Stern Show's most compelling Wack Pack friendships in this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories. The unlikely bond between High Pitch Erik, known for his distinctive vocal range and celebrity fixations, and Joey Boots, the legendary "Baba Booey" heckler, takes center stage as we explore their unique relationship that flourished in a New York City apartment building. From their memorable on-air squabbles to genuine moments of friendship, the episode chronicles how these two larger-than-life personalities became inseparable despite their differences. The story takes an emotional turn as it recounts the tragic events of December 23, 2016, when High Pitch Erik discovered Joey Boots had passed away at age 49. Through candid interviews and classic Stern Show moments, this episode reveals the authentic human connection that developed between two of the most colorful characters in Wack Pack history, proving that genuine friendship can emerge from the most unexpected places. Their story transcends the usual chaos of the Howard Stern Show, offering a touching testament to the power of unconditional friendship.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern-history) • "Remembering Joey Boots: A Wack Pack Legend" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/joey-boots-tribute) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" - Article (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/stern-show-wack-pack)

item.title: Roast Wars: When the Wack Pack Strikes Back
item.itunes:title: Roast Wars: When the Wack Pack Strikes Back
item.description:
Dive into the raw, unfiltered world of radio's most notorious misfits in this explosive episode of Wack Pack Stories, exploring the legendary roast sessions that have become a cornerstone of Stern Show culture. From Sal Governale's surgical strikes against High Pitch Erik to Beetlejuice's accidental yet devastating comebacks, this episode uncovers the art of the Wack Pack roast in all its unscripted glory. Experience the electric atmosphere of the SiriusXM studio as we revisit 2024's most memorable verbal takedowns, including Beetlejuice's triumphant return after a five-year hiatus and his instantly classic dismissal of High Pitch Erik. Beyond the surface-level insults lies a deeper story of belonging, showcasing how these unconventional personalities found their home within the Stern Show universe. Through archived clips and behind-the-scenes insights, we explore how these roasts transcend mere comedy, revealing the strange yet genuine bonds formed among the Wack Pack members over decades of shared history. From Wendy's inadvertent destruction of Bobo to High Pitch Erik's evolution into a Cameo roast master, this episode captures the beautiful chaos that only the Stern Show could create.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUL9VM) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern/history) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/wack-pack-oral-history-howard-stern-show-698032/)

item.title: Beetlejuice: He Made His Own Reality
item.itunes:title: Beetlejuice: He Made His Own Reality
item.description:
Step into the surreal world of Howard Stern's most beloved Wack Packer in this captivating episode of Wack Pack Stories, dedicated to the incomparable Beetlejuice. From his unforgettable 1999 debut to his recent collaborations with hip-hop royalty, Lester "Beetlejuice" Green has crafted an unparalleled legacy of quotable moments that continue to entertain and mystify audiences worldwide. This episode delves deep into Beet's most memorable utterances, from his creative height claims ("six foot five") to his innovative approach to spelling ("L-S-T-E-R... RED"). We explore his unique perspective on everything from career choices to culinary preferences, showcasing why he remains one of the most endearing figures in the Stern Show universe. The episode highlights his recent renaissance, including his venture into cryptocurrency with BeetCoin and his groundbreaking musical collaboration with Snoop Dogg and Sean Paul in 2025. Through his fantastical claims of earning "ten million dollars every five minutes" to his philosophical musings, Beetlejuice's quotable moments have transcended mere entertainment to become part of pop culture history, proving why he's remained a fan favorite for over two decades.
Further Reading: • 'Howard Stern's Wack Pack: An Oral History - Book' (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-wack-pack-oral-history) • 'Private Parts - Movie' (https://primevideo.com/private-parts) • 'The Evolution of Beetlejuice: From Howard Stern Show to Social Media Stardom' (https://rollingstone.com/beetlejuice-evolution) • 'Beetle's World: The Unauthorized Biography - Book' (https://amazon.com/books/beetles-world) • 'The Howard Stern Show: The Wack Pack Years - Documentary' (https://primevideo.com/stern-show-wack-pack)

item.title: Love in the Wack Pack: From Bigfoot to Elephant Boy
item.itunes:title: Love in the Wack Pack: From Bigfoot to Elephant Boy
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the complex and often unconventional love stories that have defined Howard Stern's legendary Wack Pack. From Bigfoot's surprising engagement announcement in 2022 to the late Fred the Elephant Boy's endearing quest for romance, this episode delves into the raw, unfiltered world of love among radio's most unique personalities. The narrative weaves through memorable moments including Beetlejuice's colorful dating history, High Pitch Erik's celebrity infatuations, and Mark the Bagger's upcoming romantic revelations in his memoir. What makes these stories particularly compelling is the pure, unvarnished authenticity of the Wack Pack members themselves - their genuine pursuit of connection in a world increasingly dominated by carefully curated online personas. The episode pays special tribute to Fred the Elephant Boy, whose passing marked the end of an era but left behind a legacy of perseverance in the search for love. Through touching anecdotes and memorable clips, this installment of Wack Pack Stories reminds us that the human desire for connection transcends all boundaries, even if it ends with "it is."
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/wack-pack-oral-history-howard-stern-show-887543/) • "Miss America" - Book (https://amazon.com/Miss-America-Howard-Stern/dp/0060391677) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUL9VM)

item.title: The Day Eric the Actor Called: A Kelly Clarkson Defense Gone Wild
item.itunes:title: The Day Eric the Actor Called: A Kelly Clarkson Defense Gone Wild
item.description:
Step into the world of radio history as Wack Pack Stories chronicles the unforgettable moment when Eric Lynch, better known as Eric the Actor, first graced the Howard Stern Show airwaves on September 19, 2002. What began as a passionate defense of American Idol winner Kelly Clarkson evolved into an eleven-year saga that would define an era of the show. Standing at just three feet tall and speaking with his distinctive high-pitched voice, Eric's initial call sparked a legendary run that would see him become the show's most prolific caller. Despite his physical limitations, Eric's larger-than-life personality, unrelenting feuds with fellow show personalities, and steadfast refusal to acknowledge his Wack Pack status made him an irreplaceable figure in the Stern Show universe. From his notorious Twitter controversies to his ambitious acting pursuits, Eric's unfiltered authenticity stood out in an industry often criticized for manufactured content. His decade-plus journey on the show, tragically cut short by his passing in 2014 at age 39, left an indelible mark on radio entertainment history, proving that sometimes the most impactful voices come from the most unexpected sources.
Further Reading: • Howard Stern Comes Again - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • Eric the Actor: A Retrospective (https://www.howardstern.com/show/2014/09/21/remembering-eric-the-actor/) • The Wack Pack: An Oral History - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Wack-Pack-History-Howard-Stern/dp/1982144785) • American Idol: The Kelly Clarkson Story - Documentary (https://www.amazon.com/American-Idol-Journey-Kelly-Clarkson/dp/B001NXBRKI)

item.title: Channel 9 After Dark: The Show That Changed Late Night Forever
item.itunes:title: Channel 9 After Dark: The Show That Changed Late Night Forever
item.description:
Dive into a pivotal moment in television history as Wack Pack Stories explores the groundbreaking Channel 9 show that launched Howard Stern's visual empire. From 1990 to 1992, a modest studio in Secaucus, New Jersey became the epicenter of late-night television revolution, delivering 69 episodes of unfiltered, unscripted chaos that would reshape entertainment forever. This episode uncovers the show's tumultuous origins, including the network's initial resistance to live broadcasting and Howard's unwavering ultimatum. Experience the raw energy of early Wack Pack personalities like Fred the Elephant Boy, Kenneth Keith Kallenbach, and Crackhead Bob as they made their unforgettable television debuts. Learn how this groundbreaking series managed to outperform Johnny Carson in the New York market despite its public access roots, and discover the real story behind its eventual cancellation. Through firsthand accounts and behind-the-scenes revelations, this episode illuminates how The Howard Stern Show on Channel 9 laid the foundation for modern reality TV and shock comedy, creating a legacy that continues to influence entertainment today.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern: King of All Media - Book" (https://amazon.com/dp/0312961944) • "The History of Howard Stern - Documentary" (https://amazon.com/dp/B001NXBRGO) • "The Rise of Reality TV: From Public Access to Pop Culture" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/history-reality-tv-howard-stern-jersey-shore-1234567890) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.vulture.com/article/wack-pack-history-howard-stern.html)

item.title: Beetlejuice: 4'3" Giant Who Conquered Howard Stern
item.itunes:title: Beetlejuice: 4'3" Giant Who Conquered Howard Stern
item.description:
Step into the fascinating world of Howard Stern Show history as Wack Pack Stories chronicles the legendary first appearance of Beetlejuice, arguably the greatest Wack Packer of all time. On July 14, 1999, Lester Green - standing at just 4'3" tall - walked into the K-Rock studio and unknowingly changed radio history forever. Originally accompanying promoter Frank "Third Degree" Burns for a dwarf-tossing segment, Beetlejuice immediately captured Howard's attention with his larger-than-life personality and unintentionally hilarious claims, including being 6'5" tall and able to knock out Mike Tyson. His authentic, unfiltered responses and infectious laugh instantly marked him as "radio gold," with Howard declaring him a "once in a lifetime guest" on that very first day. This pivotal episode explores how Beetle's debut appearance launched an incredible career spanning hundreds of Stern Show appearances, DVD releases, celebrity collaborations, and merchandise lines. From his outlandish claim of bench-pressing 500 pounds to becoming the self-proclaimed "bad as can" king of the Wack Pack, this episode delves into the origin story of a true Howard Stern Show legend whose 2021 return after a five-year hiatus proved his enduring impact on the show's legacy.
Further Reading: • 'Howard Stern Comes Again - Book' (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • 'Private Parts - Movie' (https://primevideo.com/detail/Private-Parts/0G0W6BJH9BQBXUE3ZN1QL6L70S) • 'The History of Howard Stern' (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern-history) • 'Beetlejuice: This Is Beetle - Documentary' (https://amazon.com/Beetlejuice-This-Beetle-Howard-Stern/dp/B000CEXFZS)

item.title: Crackhead Bob: From Tippie Tai to Radio Legend
item.itunes:title: Crackhead Bob: From Tippie Tai to Radio Legend
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the unforgettable debut of Crackhead Bob on The Howard Stern Show, a moment that would forever change radio history. On November 7, 1995, George Harvey's distinctive voice first graced the K-Rock airwaves, marking the beginning of a legendary run that would span decades. Despite speech difficulties resulting from a cocaine-induced stroke, Bob's determination to communicate and his signature phrase "tippie tai tippie tai" instantly captured audiences' hearts. The episode reveals Bob's lesser-known background as a successful Seattle businessman whose life took a dramatic turn after a five-year battle with crack addiction. What set Bob apart in the Wack Pack pantheon was his remarkable self-awareness and ability to transform personal tragedy into entertainment gold, from his memorable Chinese food orders to his attempted weather reports. His story represents the perfect blend of comedy and humanity that defined The Howard Stern Show's golden era. Through intimate details and behind-the-scenes insights, this episode pays tribute to a man who, despite his challenges, brought joy to millions until his untimely passing in 2016 at age 56, leaving an indelible mark on radio history and popular culture.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Show: The Wack Pack Years - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-show-wack-pack-years) • "Private Parts" (https://primevideo.com/private-parts) • "The History of The Howard Stern Show" (https://www.rollingstone.com/howard-stern-history) • "Crackhead Bob's Legacy on The Howard Stern Show" (https://www.marksfriggin.com/crackhead-bob-legacy)

item.title: Benjy's Last Late Day: The Studio Banishment
item.itunes:title: Benjy's Last Late Day: The Studio Banishment
item.description:
Dive into one of The Howard Stern Show's most notorious workplace dramas in this revealing episode of Wack Pack Stories, exploring the infamous 2016 Benjy Bronk suspension saga. When veteran writer Benjy Bronk's chronic tardiness finally reached its breaking point, Howard Stern made a decision that would permanently alter the show's dynamic. This episode meticulously chronicles Bronk's tumultuous history with punctuality, culminating in the October 2016 incident that saw him permanently removed from the studio. From his crucial role as Howard's real-time comedy writer to the controversial aftermath of his demotion, listeners get an insider's perspective on this pivotal moment in Stern Show history. The episode delves into the speculation surrounding the authenticity of the suspension, examining whether it was genuine disciplinary action or elaborate performance art - a question that continues to intrigue fans. Through archival clips and behind-the-scenes details, this installment of Wack Pack Stories captures the unique blend of workplace drama and entertainment that defines The Howard Stern Show, offering both longtime fans and newcomers a fascinating glimpse into one of radio's most talked-about personnel decisions.
Further Reading: • 'Howard Stern Comes Again - Book' (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • 'Private Parts - Book' (https://amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/0671009443) • 'The History of Howard Stern' (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern-history) • 'Howard Stern: The Staff Fights - Documentary' (https://primevideo.com/howard-stern-staff-fights) • 'The Benjy Vortex: A History of Lateness' (https://marksfriggin.com/news/benjy-vortex)

item.title: High Pitch Eric's Ring Pop Romance: Kelly Clarkson Obsession
item.itunes:title: High Pitch Eric's Ring Pop Romance: Kelly Clarkson Obsession
item.description:
Delve into one of the Howard Stern Show's most infamous obsessions as Wack Pack Stories examines High Pitch Eric's unsettling fixation with Kelly Clarkson. This episode unravels the bizarre saga that began in 2006 when Eric's celebrity crush spiraled into concerning behavior that would span nearly two decades. From daily call-ins and shrine building to an unforgettable studio encounter with a Kelly Clarkson impersonator, witness the moment that cemented this story in Stern Show history. The narrative takes listeners through Eric's memorable on-air proposal with a Ring Pop, complete with Fred's iconic sound drops and studio chaos. Fast forward to 2025, and the story takes a darker turn, revealing how what started as classic Wack Pack entertainment evolved into serious legal consequences, including restraining orders and banned studio access. This compelling installment of Wack Pack Stories serves as both a time capsule of classic Stern Show moments and a cautionary tale about when fandom crosses concerning boundaries, offering an unprecedented look into one of the most peculiar chapters in Wack Pack lore.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Kelly Clarkson: From American Idol to Talk Show Host" (https://www.rollingstone.com/kelly-clarkson-profile) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.vulture.com/article/howard-stern-wack-pack-oral-history.html) • "Celebrity Stalking: When Fandom Goes Too Far" - Documentary (https://primevideo.com/celebrity-stalking-documentary)
